radiographic_examinations.findings: Minor atelectasis at each lung base; common hepatic duct measures 6 mm; common bile duct measures up to 7 mm; extrahepatic biliary ducts up to 12 mm; pancreatic duct measures 3 mm; gallbladder shows marked wall thickening and intramural edema, no stones; decreased signal on in-phase relative to out-of-phase images suggests iron overload in the liver and spleen; small cyst in the anterior pancreatic head suggestive of intraductal mucinous neoplasm; multifocal scarring and thinning of the left kidney, several simple cysts in both kidneys.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Recent ultrasound showed extrahepatic biliary ducts measuring up to 12 mm, whereas they appear normal on the MRCP. No stones found in gallbladder or bile ducts.
